intro: Richella excisa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Richella excisa is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
